description: Kiwi, also known as Chinese gooseberry, is a small, oval-shaped fruit with a fuzzy brown skin and vibrant green flesh speckled with tiny black seeds. It belongs to the Actinidiaceae family and is native to China.

flavor_profile.notes: Sweet and tangy flavor with tropical characteristics

season: Fall to early winter (October-December in most regions)
storage_tips: Store unripe kiwi at room temperature until slightly soft to touch. Once ripe, refrigerate for up to 2 weeks. Cut kiwi should be consumed within 2-3 days.
preparation: Wash the skin thoroughly. Can be eaten with skin (after washing) or peeled. For jams, peel and slice or puree the flesh. Remove any hard core if present.
